intro: Eutoca grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered eutoca, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Eutoca grandiflora thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in rainforests and along riverbanks.
